The bonding material 266 extends from the connection 230c to a line 268 spaced a distance from the upper end 218c of the base 212c toward the upper periphery 232c of the skirt 214c.

In use, the flower pot cover 210c is disposed about a flower pot 244 and the crimped portion is formed by crimping together portions of the flower pot cover near and adjacent the bonding material 266 to form the crimped portion in a manner like that described before in connection with the flower pot cover 210 shown in FIG. 31, except the bonding material 240 is on the inner peripheral surface 234 of the base skirt 214, rather than the outer peripheral surface 236c as is the case with the flower pot cover 210c shown in FIG. 37.

The flower pot cover 10c includes the sheet extension 25w.
The sheet extension 25w is constructed exactly like the sheet extension 25s shown in FIGS. 1 through 3 and described in detail before.
The sheet extension 25w is formed about the floral grouping to provide the protective covering in the manner described before and has bonding material 33w for closing the sheet extension 25w.
Embodiment of FIG. 39

Shown in FIG. 39 is a flower pot cover 210d which is constructed exactly like the flower pot cover 210c shown in FIG. 38 described in detail before, except the flower pot cover 210d also includes bonding material 270 on the outer peripheral surface of the base 212d near the connection 230d.
In this instance, the crimped portion is formed by crimping together portions of the base 212d and the skirt 214d having the bonding materials 270 and 266 respectively thereon.

The flower pot cover 210d includes the sheet extension 25x.
The sheet extension 25x is constructed exactly like the sheet extension 25s shown in FIGS. 31 through 33 and described in detail before.
The sheet extension 25x is formed about the floral grouping to provide the protective covering in the manner described before and has a bonding material 33x for closing the sheet extension 25x.
Embodiment of FIG. 40

Shown in FIG. 40 is another modified flower pot cover 210e which is constructed exactly like the flower pot cover 210d, except the flower pot cover 210e does not include the bonding material 266 on the skirt.
Rather, the flower pot cover 210e includes only a bonding material 274 on the base 212e which extends to a line 276.
The flower pot cover 210e will operate to form the crimped portion in a manner exactly like that described before with respect to the flower pot covers 210c and 210d shown in FIGS. 38 and 39, except the crimped portion only will be formed by crimping together portions of the bonding material 274 on the base 212e.

The flower pot cover 10e includes the sheet extension 25y.
The sheet extension 25y is constructed exactly like the sheet extension 25s shown in FIGS. 31 through 33 and described in detail before.
The sheet extension 25y is formed about the floral grouping to provide the protective covering in the manner described before and has a bonding material 33y for closing the sheet extension 25y.
The sheet extensions 25s, 25t, 25u, 25w, 25x and 25y may be constructed like any of the other sheet extensions described herein as may be desired in a particular application.

Changes may be made in the construction and the operation of the various components, elements and assemblies described herein and changes may be made in the steps or the sequence of steps of the methods described herein without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention as defined in the following claims.

claim.claim-text: A method for providing a decorative covering and a protective covering comprising:

providing a cover having a lower portion having an upper end, a lower end, an outer peripheral surface and a pot opening formed through the upper end of the lower portion providing access to a pot receiving space, an adhesive or cohesive bonding material being disposed on the lower portion; providing a flower pot having an upper end, a lower end and an outer peripheral surface with a floral grouping being disposed in the flower pot; disposing the flower pot in the pot receiving space of the lower portion;
and forming a crimped portion in the lower portion by crimping together portions of the lower portion with the adhesive or cohesive bonding material thereon thereby providing a decorative cover.
2. The method of claim 1 wherein the step of forming the crimped portion is defined further as forming the crimped portion extending circumferentially about the lower portion.
3. The method of claim 1 wherein in the step of providing the cover, the lower portion has the adhesive or cohesive bonding material disposed on an inner peripheral surface thereof.
4. The method of claim 1 wherein in the step of providing the cover, the lower portion has the adhesive or cohesive bonding material disposed on the outer peripheral surface thereof.
5. The method of claim 1 wherein in the step of providing the cover, the lower portion is defined further as comprising a skirt portion.

6. A method for providing a decorative covering and a protective covering comprising: providing a cover having a lower portion having an upper end, a lower end, an outer peripheral surface and a pot opening formed through the upper end of the lower portion providing access to a pot receiving space, an adhesive or cohesive bonding material being disposed on the lower portion, and the cover having an upper extension which is detachable from the lower portion; providing a flower pot having an upper end, a lower end and an outer peripheral surface with a floral grouping being disposed in the flower pot; disposing the flower pot in the pot receiving space of the lower portion; forming a crimped portion in the lower portion by crimping together portions of the lower portion with the adhesive or cohesive bonding material thereon thereby providing a decorative cover;
and forming the upper extension about the floral grouping to provide a protective covering.
7. The method of claim 6 wherein the step of providing the cover, the lower portion has the adhesive or cohesive bonding material disposed on an inner peripheral surface thereof.
8. The method of claim 6 wherein the step of providing the cover, the lower portion has the adhesive or cohesive bonding material disposed on the outer peripheral surface thereof.
9. The method of claim 6 wherein the step of forming the crimped portion is defined further as forming the crimped portion extending circumferentially about the lower portion.
10. The method of claim 6 wherein in the step of providing the cover, the lower portion is defined further as comprising a skirt portion.

11. A method for providing a decorative covering and a protective covering comprising: providing a cover having a lower portion comprising a base having an upper end, a lower end, an outer peripheral surface, an inner peripheral surface and a pot opening formed through the upper end of the base providing access to a pot receiving space, and a skirt extending a distance outwardly from the upper end of the base terminating with an outer edge, the skirt having an outer peripheral surface and an inner peripheral surface, an adhesive or cohesive bonding material being disposed on a portion of at least one of the base and the skirt; providing a flower pot having an upper end, a lower end and an outer peripheral surface with a floral grouping being disposed in the flower pot; disposing the flower pot in the pot receiving space of the base; forming a crimped portion in that portion of the lower portion skirt having the adhesive or cohesive bonding material thereon by crimping together portions of the lower portion with the adhesive or cohesive bonding material thereon thereby providing a decorative cover.

12. The method of claim 11 wherein in the step of providing the cover, the adhesive or cohesive bonding material is disposed on the inner peripheral surface of the base or of the skirt, or of both the base and the skirt.

13. The method of claim 11 wherein in the step of providing the cover, the adhesive or cohesive bonding material is disposed on the outer peripheral surface of the base or of the skirt, or of both the base and the skirt.
